description: From Ancient Greek τρίπτυχος (tríptukhos, “consisting of three layers, threefold”), from τρί- (trí-) + πτυχή (ptukhḗ, “a fold”).

entries.meaning: (art) A picture or series of pictures painted on three tablets connected by hinges.
(philately) A set of three se-tenant postage stamps that form a composite picture.
